# setTitle(_:forSegmentAt:)

**Instance Method**

Sets the title of a segment.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func setTitle(_ title: String?, forSegmentAt segment: Int)
```

## Parameters

- **title**: A string to display in the segment as its title.
- **segment**: An index number identifying a segment in the control. It must be a number between 0 and the number of segments ([doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISegmentedControl/numberOfSegments]) minus 1; the segmented control pins values exceeding this upper range to the last segment.

## Discussion

A segment can have only an image or a title; it can’t have both. There’s no default title.

## Managing segment content

- **setImage(_:forSegmentAt:)**: Sets the content of a segment to a given image.
- **imageForSegment(at:)**: Returns the image for a specific segment.
- **titleForSegment(at:)**: Returns the title of the specified segment.
